required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 10, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tau Screening Study in Subjects With Early Symptomatic AD
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Screening Study With Flortaucipir F 18 in Patients With Early Symptomatic AD; #2

brief_summary.textblock: This protocol is designed to serve as a pre-screening study for subjects who are potentially eligible for Alzheimer's Disease (AD) therapeutic trials that require tau imaging for inclusion by means of a flortaucipir F18 Positron Emission Tomography (PET) scan.

primary_outcome.description: Flortaucipir PET scans were rated visually by an expert reader as follows: Not consistent with an AD pattern (τAD-), Moderate AD pattern (τAD+), or Advanced AD pattern and likely to progress (τAD++). Eligibility for future studies was determined from the flortaucipir PET scan according to protocol-specified criteria.

Flortaucipir standardized uptake value ratio (SUVr). A value of 1 signifies no flortaucipir activity above background, values greater than 1 signify increasing flortaucipir activity in the brain. Visual read categories as described for previous measure.

intervention.description: positron emission tomography (PET) scan of the brain

facility.name: Neuropsychiatric Research Center of Southwest Florida

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Enrollment occurred between Mar 2018 and Nov 2018. Recruited subjects with clinically diagnosed early AD who were interested in participating in AD therapeutic clinical trials being conducted by Eli Lilly and Company.

group.title: Early Symptomatic AD Subjects
group.description: Early Symptomatic AD subjects in the flortaucipir PET scan arm

group.title: Early Symptomatic AD Subjects
group.description: Early Symptomatic AD subjects in the flortaucipir PET scan arm

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: MMSE
measure.description: Mini-mental status exam (MMSE) is a 30-point questionnaire that is used to measure cognitive impairment. Scores range from 0 to 30 with lower scores representing greater levels of cognitive impairment.

outcome.title: Flortaucipir Qualitative Results (Visual Reads)
outcome.description: Flortaucipir PET scans were rated visually by an expert reader as follows: Not consistent with an AD pattern (τAD-), Moderate AD pattern (τAD+), or Advanced AD pattern and likely to progress (τAD++). Eligibility for future studies was determined from the flortaucipir PET scan according to protocol-specified criteria.

group.title: Early Symptomatic AD, Eligible for Future Trials
group.description: Subjects determined to be eligible for future studies from the flortaucipir PET scan arm.

group.title: Early Symptomatic AD, Ineligible for Future Trials
group.description: Subjects who were not eligible for future studies from the flortaucipir PET scan arm.

group.title: Early Symptomatic AD, Not Evaluable
group.description: Subjects determined to be not eligible for future studies from the flortaucipir PET scan arm due to unevaluable PET scan for quantitation

group.title: Early Symptomatic AD (Total)
group.description: All subjects with early symptomatic AD from the flortaucipir PET scan arm

measure.title: Flortaucipir Qualitative Results (Visual Reads)
measure.description: Flortaucipir PET scans were rated visually by an expert reader as follows: Not consistent with an AD pattern (τAD-), Moderate AD pattern (τAD+), or Advanced AD pattern and likely to progress (τAD++). Eligibility for future studies was determined from the flortaucipir PET scan according to protocol-specified criteria.

category.title: τAD-, pattern not consistent with AD

outcome.title: Flortaucipir Quantitative Results (SUVr)
outcome.description: Flortaucipir standardized uptake value ratio (SUVr). A value of 1 signifies no flortaucipir activity above background, values greater than 1 signify increasing flortaucipir activity in the brain. Visual read categories as described for previous measure.
outcome.population: SUVr was not collected for patients with a τAD- result (n=82) and one subject had an unevaluable flortaucipir scan for quantitation. Therefore, analysis population n=78.

group.title: Early Symptomatic AD, Eligible for Future Trials
group.description: Subjects determined to be eligible for future studies from the flortaucipir PET scan arm.

group.title: Early Symptomatic AD, Ineligible for Future Trials
group.description: Subjects who were not eligible for future studies from the flortaucipir PET scan arm.

group.title: Early Symptomatic AD, Not Evaluable
group.description: Subjects determined to be not eligible for future studies from the flortaucipir PET scan arm due to unevaluable PET scan for quantitation

group.title: Early Symptomatic AD (Total)
group.description: All subjects with early symptomatic AD from the flortaucipir PET scan arm

measure.title: Flortaucipir Quantitative Results (SUVr)
measure.description: Flortaucipir standardized uptake value ratio (SUVr). A value of 1 signifies no flortaucipir activity above background, values greater than 1 signify increasing flortaucipir activity in the brain. Visual read categories as described for previous measure.
measure.population: SUVr was not collected for patients with a τAD- result (n=82) and one subject had an unevaluable flortaucipir scan for quantitation. Therefore, analysis population n=78.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events (AEs) were collected at scan visits, regardless of attribution to study drug. End of study for AE reporting was 48 hours after the last study drug administration. AEs occurring after study drug administration, but outside that window were not recorded, unless considered attributable to study drug.

group.title: Safety Analysis Population
group.description: All subjects with early symptomatic AD from the flortaucipir PET scan arm who received one dose of flortaucipir

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
